page.title: 18Cash's Factory.
page.content: Cash's factory was built in 1856 by 2 brothers, John and Joseph Cash. They built their silk-weaving factory in Kingfield Rd. They built houses for their workers and the workshops were built above the houses on the second floor.The energy for the machines was provided by steam.The industry produced ribbons which were used by ladies for their hats, hair and dresses. Soldiers used them for their medals.The workshops had large windows to let in plenty of light.Some of the buildings were used by Cash's until last year but the factory has now moved to new premises in Tile Hill. Coventry Churches Housing Association have bought the old houses and factory and made them into modern rented homes.
